name: redis-commander
description: Redis Commander is a self-hosted web UI for browsing and managing Redis databases. It displays keys, values, TTLs, and supports CRUD operations for easier debugging.
features: Key browsing: Navigate Redis databases with a tree view showing all keys organized by pattern.
Value editing: View and modify string, list, set, hash, and sorted set values through the web interface.
TTL management: Check and update time-to-live values for keys to control expiration.
Multi-database support: Switch between Redis databases and manage multiple instances from one interface.
Search functionality: Find keys quickly using pattern matching or full-text search.
CRUD operations: Create, read, update, and delete keys and values without using the command line.
Command console: Execute raw Redis commands directly from the browser for advanced operations.
Data export: Download database contents in JSON or Redis protocol format for backup or migration.
Import functionality: Load data from files to populate or restore Redis databases.
Connection management: Save and switch between multiple Redis server configurations.
Read-only mode: Prevent accidental modifications by enabling view-only access to production databases.
Authentication support: Connect to password-protected Redis instances with credential management.
